which is parallel to `LinearMap.submoduleMap`.

`+ _root_.AlgHom.subalgebraMap_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
```

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12119354391/job/33785748846)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12119354391/job/33785749166)

Parallel to `LinearMap.submoduleMap`, I suggest you use [AlgHom.codRestrict](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Subalgebra/Basic.html#AlgHom.codRestrict) to define this. Hopefully the proof of the last lemma becomes easier. (Can't you copy the same proof now?)

> Parallel to `LinearMap.submoduleMap`, I suggest you use [AlgHom.codRestrict](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Subalgebra/Basic.html#AlgHom.codRestrict) to define this. Hopefully the proof of the last lemma becomes easier. (Can't you copy the same proof now?)

I'm not sure, since last lemma says `Surjective`. `rangeRestrict` is naturally surjective ([AlgHom.rangeRestrict_surjective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Subalgebra/Basic.html#AlgHom.rangeRestrict_surjective)) but we don't have this for `codRestrict`. Let me think a bit.

> Can't you copy the same proof now?

No, as the definition of `LinearMap.submoduleMap` uses [LinearMap.restrict](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Submodule/LinearMap.html#LinearMap.restrict) which is not available for `AlgHom`...

I think the last proof becomes one line if we have `AlgEquiv.comp_surjective`, but seems that it's only for `EquivLike` which provided a unified API but each time we need `simp only XXX`.

Maybe I can try `simpa using XXX`...
OK `simpa` works. Do you think this is OK?

I was suggesting
```suggestion
def _root_.AlgHom.subalgebraMap : S →ₐ[R] S.map f :=
  (f.comp S.val).codRestrict _ fun x ↦ ⟨_, x.2, rfl⟩
```

This works with your original def as well as my suggested one. Lean can't infer `S.toAddSubmonoid` so you have to specify it.
```suggestion
theorem _root_.AlgHom.subalgebraMap_surjective : Function.Surjective (f.subalgebraMap S) :=
  f.toAddMonoidHom.addSubmonoidMap_surjective S.toAddSubmonoid
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Algebra/Subalgebra/Basic): add `AlgHom.subalgebraMap`
